sentence.text: Here we show that a series of transcription fcoenzyme A biosynthetic processors, including C/EBPβ, regulation of transcription, DNA-templated, and negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, could act as potential modulators of histone methylation in tumor cells.

entity.text: negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Of note, C/EBPβ, an independent prognostic fcoenzyme A biosynthetic processor for patients with ovarian cancer, mediates an important mechanism through which epigenetic enzyme modifies groups of functionally related genes in a context-dependent manner.

By recruiting the methyltransferase positive regulation of cell proliferation, C/EBPβ can maintain an open chromatin state by H3K79 methylation of multiple drug-resistance genes, thereby augmenting the chemoresistance of tumor cells.
